attributes.action: Deport every single migrant who enters Britain illegally.
attributes.additional_details: The British government is the only organisation that can do this, and it is a duty they owe to the people who elected them.
attributes.background:
When people cross the channel and arrive in Britain illegally, they should be held in a secure location, before being deported back to France within 48 hours.
Putting these people in hotels encourages more of them to come here, and is totally against the wishes of the British people.

rejection.details:
The Illegal Migration Act 2023  became law on 20 July this year. The Government states it "changes the law so that those who arrive in the UK illegally will not be able to stay here and will instead be detained and then promptly removed, either to their home country or a safe third country." We're therefore not exactly sure what further action you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to take. 

You can find out more about he Illegal Migration Act 2023 here: 
https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/illegal-migration-bill
